title: Why we Visit Agra City?
text:
Why we Visit Agra City? Why we Visit Agra City? 0 
Everyone knows why peoples are visiting the Agra city. The reason is Taj Mahal. The Taj Mahal is one of the Seven Wonders of the World. And it's also known as a world heritage site. Taj the symbol of love built in the year 1632 in the memory of Mumtaz Mahal, his wife by Emperor Shah Jahan. 
Don't miss to visit: 
Keoladeo Ghana Park 
Keoladeo National Park is situated on the border of states Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan, it is also one of the biggest Bird Sanctuary and National Park in India. When you plan to visit Keoladeo Ghana Park, winter is definitely an awesome time to visit. There are many colourful birds in Keoladeo Ghana Park like ducks, pelicans, egrets, ibises, cranes, geese, kingfishers, mynah, ostrich, peacock, swan, woodpecker, cuckoo, dove, sparrow turkey and skylark. 
Taj Mahotsav Agra 
Taj Mahotsav, Agra is the most popular festival in Agra which was started in the year 1992.This festival in celebrated up to 10 days from 18 to 27 February every year. The Taj Mahotsav festival starts with decorated camels and elephants like victory procession of warlords and Mughal Emperors. Trumpet players, Drum beaters, folk dancers, artisans and skilled craftsmen join the procession. Artists are come here from all over the India to display their talents in craftmanship and art. 
Agra Famous Sweets 
Agra's Petha is most famous sweet in India and also out of India. The Agra Famous Sweets available in many flavors, Dry Kesar Petha, Angoori Petha, Lal Petha, Slice Petha, Freshings Plain Dry Petha, Doda Peth, Palatable-Petha, Agra Taj Petha, Sandwich PethaChocolate Petha, Peda, Sohan Papdi, Sugar Free PethaSpecial, Gur Gajak, Spinch Petha, Kancha Petha, Gajak Kutama, Kashmiri Chikki, Kesar Angoori Petha, Pan Petha, Rasbhari Petha, Santra Petha, Cherry Mango Petha, and Barfi. 
Holi Celebration Mathura 
Holi celebration in Vrindavan and Mathura is famous. Holi is also known as festival of colours. Holi Festival celebration is start with Chhoti Holi or Holika Dahan, in night firstly Holika Bonfires and then all are spray colors on others, dance, party, and eat delicacies sweets like gujiya, pudding, malapua, thandai, majoon, Badam Barfi, anjeer ain kharkun ji mithai, Sweet Kachori, gheear, gheeyar,kesar pista kulfi, Vaango, semolina,Bellagio and Chutney. 
Krishna Janmashtami Festival 
Krishna Janmashtami Festival is mainly famous in Mathura. In this day Sri Krishna was born in Mathura. It is also known as Gokulashtami,Ashtami Rohini, Krishnashtami, Sri Krishna Jayanti. This festival is celebrated in month of August or September in every year. Indian celebrates Krishan Janmashtami by praying, staying and fasting until mid-night, we believed Krishna have born that time. 
Full Moon and Taj 
Taj Mahal, considered as symbol of love, romantic monuments so on. The experience of love and romance of Taj Mahal at full moon night and also celebrates extra services and facilities with tour and travels in Agra.
